subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Chris Huff, not Moon?
author: juli velazquez
full_text:
--0-2132939192-1197260642=:73089
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Mike, I glad someone listens to my interviews, lol!!!  Sure anytime, just email me under separate cover.  Looking forward to talking with you.
   
  Juli

"M.A. Coletta (Mike)" <michaelcoletta@...> wrote:
          Ahh... thanks, Juli!
By-the-way, today I listened to an interview you did not long ago. 
You have a lot of knowledge and experience. I'd love to get you on my 
show sometime... if that's okay with you.
It's at http://www.ghosttoghostpm.com

Let me know what you think about being a guest.
Thanks!

- Mike

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, juli velazquez <ghostchasingfool@...> 
wrote:
>
> yes I actually do. Chris was in a band called cold moon, thus the 
name Chris Moon was born.
> 
> "M.A. Coletta (Mike)" <michaelcoletta@...> wrote: This is 
just a meaningless tidbit I thought I'd share...
> 
> While doing some internet reading this evening I came across a few 
> articles which led me to think that Chris Moon may be a "stage 
name" 
> for the person actually named, Chris Huff (Christopher Edward Huff 
to 
> be exact). I see his daughters last name is Huff, and his fathers 
last 
> name is Huff... so why isn't his, Chris', last name Huff? Anyone 
got 
> the 411 on this a.k.a.?
> 
> Here are the three articles I found:
> 
> http://ghostofcoast.blogspot.com/2007/03/i-smell-another-scam-about-
to-
> happen.html (See comment at end of article)
> 
> 
http://www.mscd.edu/~themet/TheMetropolitan/06_07/Vol29_issue30/metros
pe
> ctive/haunting.html
> 
> http://www.masonhouseinn.com/Joy's%20Journal%202006_happenings.htm
> 
> - Mike
> 
>
